query:
介绍一下Eastern Destiny这家中国Beijing的公司产品。
他主要做Industrial, Travel方面的业务方面。
我需要他进一步的产品介绍，功能介绍，官网链接，服务的客户
answer: Eastern Destiny（北京）是一家专注于工业与旅游行业数字化解决方案的科技公司，旗下主要产品包括面向制造业的“E‑Destiny工业云平台”，该平台提供设备状态实时采集、云端大数据存储、AI预测性维护、远程监控与控制、工艺优化与能耗管理等功能，帮助企业实现生产过程的可视化、智能化和节能降本；以及面向旅行社、航空公司和酒店的“Travel Smart”一体化预订与客流管理系统，涵盖多渠道（PC、移动端、微信小程序）机票、酒店、门票等商品的集中采购、库存同步、订单处理、支付结算及旅客数据分析，支持会员营销和动态定价。公司官网为 https://www.eastern-destiny.com，已为多家国有大型企业（如中国铁路、华能集团、华润石化）以及知名旅游平台（如携程、国航、首旅集团）提供软硬件一体化服务。

While the local élite still yearned for a return to entrepôt trade it was clear to many officials that only industry could salvage the economy and provide employment to a refugee-swollen population. Officials, however, had no leverage over this flourishing sector. The venerable and largely Cantonese Chinese Manufacturers’ Association represented local factories, yet the Association traditionally looked to Empire and Asian markets rather than to [...] soared, stocks boomed and in just ten years a city of cheap manufactures became a centre of international finance. By the end of the decade even Cantopop was briefly eclipsed as Hong Kong’s first locally born generation headed for the scandalous hedonism of Lan Kwai Fong’s Disco Disco. From the beginning of the Seventies Hong Kong’s tough, post-war years of crisis and haphazard survival quite suddenly gave way to an era of progressive planning and design. “Our design for an improved industrial [...] specifications from abroad”. Recalling the early Seventies, the head of a lively design department in a teacher training college conceded that: “We used these words like ‘creativity’ and ‘individuality’ in our prospectus, but what was really wanted were designers who could translate the ideas of foreign buyers”.
